resources.string: Using Secured Wallet is at your own risk.
Secured Wallet was created by Yinnon Bratspiess.
We are not responsible for direct, indirect, incidental or consequential damages that can occur upon using Secured Wallet.
There is no kind of guarantee whatsoever given by Secured Wallet for your data and in case it was stolen or lost it is only your own responsibility.
Please Enter A Key & A Value

Could\'nt edit item because an item with the same key is already exists

Welcome to Secured Wallet and thanks for your choice ! 
Secured Wallet provides you a simple solution for storing your personal info on your device.
Please notice that all of your data is saved only on the current device and is not stored on cloud so you won't be able to see it on other devices.
Moreover, Secured Wallet can work offline. No internet connection is needed in order to use Secured Wallet.
Click on 'Next' button for a quick guide before you dive in.

Before starting you have to create a user.
Creating a new user is very easy. All you have to do is just to provide the desired username and password.
On the main screen press 'Create a new user' button and create one for yourself.
Please notice that a username is unique. You cannot have two users with the same name on your device.

Congratulations, you know how to create a new user !
And now, for our easy to use wallet !
All you have to do is just enter your desired items. This can be simply done by clicking on 'add item' which located on the menu.
Item is composed from two simple strings. The first one is the key for your item and the second one is the value.
Key is the name of your item, For example 'Visa card'.
Value is the info you want to store about your item, For example for the key 'Visa card' we can store its personal code '1234'.
After adding an item you can easily edit and delete it by long click on it.
Please notice that a key is unique. You cannot have two items with the same key on one wallet.
Simple !

Using Secured Wallet is at your own risk.\nWe are not responsible for direct, indirect, incidental or consequential damages that can occur upon using Secured Wallet.\nThere is no kind of guarantee whatsoever given by Secured Wallet for your data and in case it was stolen or lost it is only your own responsibility.
